class.name: ShapeFill
class.description: Represents the fill formatting of a shape object.

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description: Specifies the shape fill background color. You can provide the value in the '#RRGGBB' format or the color name.

examples.description: Set the background color of a shape's fill to light blue using a hex color code

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a ShapeFill object to verify the connection to the Word host application before applying fill formatting.

properties.name: foregroundColor
properties.description: Specifies the shape fill foreground color. You can provide the value in the '#RRGGBB' format or the color name.

examples.description: Set the foreground color of a shape's fill to blue

properties.name: transparency
properties.description: Specifies the transparency percentage of the fill as a value from 0.0 (opaque) through 1.0 (clear). Returns null if the shape type does not support transparency or the shape fill has inconsistent transparency, such as with a gradient fill type.

examples.description: Set a rectangle shape's fill transparency to 50% to make it semi-transparent

properties.name: type
properties.description: Returns the fill type of the shape. See Word.ShapeFillType for details.

examples.description: Check the fill type of a shape and display it to the user

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Clears the fill formatting of this shape and set it to Word.ShapeFillType.NoFill;

examples.description: Clear the fill formatting from the first shape in the document and set it to no fill

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: `propertyNamesAndPaths.select` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and `propertyNamesAndPaths.expand` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and read the fill color of the first shape in the document

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

examples.description: Set the fill color and transparency of a shape to create a semi-transparent blue background

methods.name: setSolidColor
methods.description: Sets the fill formatting of the shape to a uniform color. This changes the fill type to Word.ShapeFillType.Solid.

params.name: color
params.description: A string that represents the fill foreground color. You can provide the value in the '#RRGGBB' format or the color name.

examples.description: Set the fill color of the first shape in the document to solid red

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.ShapeFill object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.ShapeFillData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Get the fill properties of a shape as a plain JavaScript object and log it to the console for inspection or serialization.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a shape's fill object to maintain its reference across multiple sync calls while changing its color properties in separate batches

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Get a shape's fill properties, use them, then untrack the fill object to free memory resources.
